channel.title: "Obese family in harsh spotlight"
channel.description:
The Chawner family describe the abuse they have had to contend with They have been lambasted in the press and laughed at by neighbours. Here, the Chawner family, with a combined weight of 83 stones, describe their distress at unwanted attention and abuse. Emma Chawner is responsible for one of the most famous (or infamous) renditions of Celine Dion's My Heart Will Go On. The 19-year-old from Blackburn first came to the nation's attention two years ago when she first applied for The X Factor. In a memorable audition, she was roundly condemned for both her dress sense and singing abilities by Simon Cowell. He described the dress she was wearing as "like a wedding dress, and then you sang the song out of tune and a bit like a baby". But Emma and her family say the criticism dished out by the judges is nothing compared to the abuse they have suffered since.
Etc etc, http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7970491.stm What I find funny though, is,
"I hope people are going to listen to this. As I say, we do not scoff ourselves with chocolate or any fattening foods, we just eat what we enjoy and we only have one big meal a day."
and
Lancashire Police confirmed that they had received a complaint from the Chawner family about abuse directed at them on the Facebook site.
If you're just eating what you "like", and having one big meal a day, of course your not going to lose weight. Also, what's up with being on facebook? If £22k isn't enough to live on, they shouldn't be spending it on luxuries.

item.title: "Obese family in harsh spotlight"
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:15, topic:270176”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=356590.msg2738918#msg2738918 date=1239211290]

“We do eat fruit and vegetables. The girls are always eating pears and bananas and what are those little orange things called? Oh yeah, mandarins. It’s not right to say we only eat junk.”

Lmao. http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/top-stories/2009/03/19/83st-family-s-too-fat-to-work-and-too-busy-watching-tv-to-diet-115875-21210567/this article rips them apart

the mirror is almost as bad as the sun, red top newspapers aren’t generally to be trusted
[/quote]

Yeah I can see why. But it was still a funny read.[/quote]

++ to that one!

Read full topic

item.title: "Obese family in harsh spotlight"
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:10, topic:270176”]There isn’t really a gene that makes you fat. It’s caused by your metabolism. If you have a slow metabolism, you should change your diet to one that won’t make you fat. Diabetes is often caused by being fat, so they can’t blame it to that either.

This is just a case of “I think fat food tastes good so I’ll eat it all day and then I’ll be so fat I don’t have to work so I can rely on my fellow citizens to pay my food so I’ll get fatter and if I don’t get enough I’ll go the a newspaper and blame everyone for laughing at me”.[/quote]
I think they just stick with a horrible diet and blame it on genes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

There isn’t really a gene that makes you fat. It’s caused by your metabolism. If you have a slow metabolism, you should change your diet to one that won’t make you fat. Diabetes is often caused by being fat, so they can’t blame it to that either.

This is just a case of “I think fat food tastes good so I’ll eat it all day and then I’ll be so fat I don’t have to work so I can rely on my fellow citizens to pay my food so I’ll get fatter and if I don’t get enough I’ll go the a newspaper and blame everyone for laughing at me”.

item.title: "Obese family in harsh spotlight"
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

unwanted attention and abuse.

Unwanted attention? They got their fat asses in the newspaper and all, so you must be living in winter wonderland if you don’t expect unwanted attention.

Oh and there’s no abuse more worse then self abuse. And being fat as these shame-on-human-beings-bringers is a great example of self abuse.

Read full topic
